title: I want to apologize to all Support Mains out there

depends on what you max first in lane. If you max W then this is a huge nerf since you aren't healing yourself as much but if you max Q first you are getting your self heal maxed a lot sooner. The rest is just ok, the slow being decreased is a pain but you had to hit right in the center for it to be of use now you just have to hit your Q. The extra damage lost is not that big of a thing since you don't pick Soraka for her damage, kinda weird she isn't getting an AP ratio boost though. The main thing i would look out for is how much the radius decrease is going to affect the skill. It's not being reduced by that much but it can make the skill just feel worthless to use if it's too much

I think it's neither. They reduce the AoE size of the spell, but the whole spell will act like the center-spot of the current one. Also, it moves your self-healing from W to Q, which means you have to choose to either heal an ally (max W) or poke and heal yourself (max Q).

I wouldn't say "buff or nerf", I think they just redistributed her power in a way where you have to choose what you want to do at a given moment (have an unkillable carry or poke hard and get a lot of sustain).

Knees wobbling, I lift myself up from where I rest, joints cracking.  My humble walking stick feels heavy in my hands as I support my weight pulling myself to standing height.  My eyes drift upwards, I catch my breathe to hack a cough clearing my throat.

"These builds are green and lush, full of gold and items on which you choose to build."  Exhaling slowly, I look up at the Fist bump in the sky.
"I remember, when Items were a privilege, when philosopher's stone was your savings account, heart of gold was your mortgage, and you would give it all, but for a spot of light in the dark."  Learning forward, my eyelids shut slowly.

"I can still see the light."

It really doesn't seem that hard a problem to address. The easiest solution I can think of off the top of my head is to only unlock heightened stat increases after a certain amount of gold has been generated with the passive (not GP10) component of the support item in question. You could buy a Frost Queen's and get the active component and improved passives, but won't get the full stat weight until a certain amount of gold has been earned from the Tribute passive. This change coupled with last hits disrupting the passive will immediately make the fully upgraded Frost Queen's not worth the investment to an average mid without disrupting support access to the item.
